intro: Pseudocyclosorus subornatipes, commonly known as the golden spike moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, creeping growth habit and bright yellow-green foliage. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a distinct midrib and a narrow, elongated shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with high humidity. Its unique morphology and coloration make it a notable species in the study of bryophyte botany.
